question1.question: What is the largest planet in our solar system?

question2.question: Which planet in our solar system has massive rings that are easily visible with a small telescope?

question3.question: Mars is often called “The Red Planet,” but why does it look so red to begin with?
question3.option1: Mars is covered by a thick blanket of clouds that only reflect black red light
question3.option2: The surface is incredibly hot, causing it to glow
question3.option3: The surface has a lot of iron which turns orange-red when it rusts
question3.option4: The Martian atmosphere has lots of red dust particles

question4.question: Did you know that there is a planet that spins on its side? Which planet is it?

question5.question: During the day this planet gets hot enough to melt lead, but at night the temperature drops to -290°F?

question1.question: Did you know earth is flat?
